Description: Painted pottery shabti of Nbt pr Šmʿyt n Imn Inh3y with a blue lappet-wig, a brown modelled face with black and white eyes, a blue and white collar that encloses the parallel brown hands in relief holding two red hoes; the front of the yellow leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs flanked by seven similar rows; the back is decorated with a red and yellow representation of a seed-basket beneath a red yoke with two pendular nw-pots.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1983 Aug-Oct, Stratford, Passmore Edwards Museum, Life & Death in Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
